title: Marton Fucsovics announces engagement to Nini Molnar
description: Marton Fucsovics is the latest ATP Tour star to find the offseason as a fitting time to announce his engagement. Fucsovics took to Instagram Sunday to inform fans of his engagement to Nini Molnar, a fellow Hungarian. Fucsovics, the No. 104 in the PIF ATP Rankings, proposed and they took a selfie in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris. "We met more than a year ago and it was love at first sight," Fucsovics told ATPTour.com. "It was a difficult year for me professionally, but my personal life helped me through it. I knew that she is the best for me, so I didn't want to wait another year with the engagement. Like this I'm stepping into 2025 with relief and even more motivated." [ATP APP] Last month, Felix Auger-Aliassime, Alexei Popyrin and Casper Ruud all announced their engagements to Nina Ghaibi, Amy Pederick and Maria Galligani, respectively. Fucsovics reached a career high of No. 31 in the PIF ATP Rankings in 2019 and has two tour-level titles to his name. In April, the 32-year-old triumphed at the clay-court ATP 250 event in Bucharest for his first crown since 2018. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Hungarian shares post on social media

December 16, 2024

Marton Fucsovics

Nini Molnar and Marton Fucsovics celebrate their engagament in Paris. By ATP Staff

Marton Fucsovics is the latest ATP Tour star to find the offseason as a fitting time to announce his engagement.

Fucsovics took to Instagram Sunday to inform fans of his engagement to Nini Molnar, a fellow Hungarian. Fucsovics, the No. 104 in the PIF ATP Rankings, proposed and they took a selfie in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris.

"We met more than a year ago and it was love at first sight," Fucsovics told ATPTour.com. "It was a difficult year for me professionally, but my personal life helped me through it. I knew that she is the best for me, so I didn't want to wait another year with the engagement. Like this I'm stepping into 2025 with relief and even more motivated."

Last month, Felix Auger-Aliassime, Alexei Popyrin and Casper Ruud all announced their engagements to Nina Ghaibi, Amy Pederick and Maria Galligani, respectively.

Fucsovics reached a career high of No. 31 in the PIF ATP Rankings in 2019 and has two tour-level titles to his name. In April, the 32-year-old triumphed at the clay-court ATP 250 event in Bucharest for his first crown since 2018.
